metadata.title: CVE-2013-1854 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The Active Record component in Ruby on Rails 2.3.x before 2.3.18, 3.1.xbefore 3.1.12, and 3.2.x before 3.2.13 processes certain queries byconverting hash keys to symbols, which allows remote attackers to cause adenial of service via crafted input to a where method.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-1854` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ruby-activerecord-3.2 - 3.2.6-5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ruby-activerecord-3.2 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.2.6-5').
